title: Edwin Gray Appointed FHLBB Chairman: Regulator from Industry
summary: Reagan appoints Edwin Gray as Chairman of the Federal Home Loan Bank Board, exemplifying regulatory capture through appointment of a former thrift industry executive to oversee the industry. Gray initially reduces thrift examinations by 26% between 1981-1984, cuts regulatory staff, and lowers net worth requirements from 5% to 3%. Starting S&L examiner salaries are set at just 4,000 annually, with average examiner tenure of only 2 years. The OMB controls examiner funding rather than the FHLBB, creating institutional conflicts that favor industry over oversight.

sources.title: Edwin Gray on the S&L Crisis: This Was a Self-Inflicted Disaster
